oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Well Baby Clinic at Cayce Homes
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of women with babies at the "Well Baby Clinic" at the James A. Cayce Homes, circa 1950s. The Well Baby Clinics were established in the early 1950s by the Davidson County Health Department for the purpose of preventing childhood illness through routine physical check-ups and vaccinations. Photographed by the Nashville Housing Authority. Forms part of the MDHA Photograph Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Nashville Housing Authority (Nashville, Tenn.);
